args:
New Alberia, still vulnerable in its infancy, is
in dire need of allies. As such, the prince and
his entourage find themselves slogging through
the swamplands to Saint Lotier—also known as
the Aquapolis—with a treaty in hand.
A new kingdom raises its standard at the south of\nGrastaea under {player_name}'s rule.

The birth of New Alberia deep in the heart of the
Dyrenell Empire sends a shockwave across South
Grastaea, reverberating through the leadership of
the imperial forces.
New Alberia? So someone has rebelled\nagainst the empire, mmm?
Not that it matters. If they're fool enough\nto attack us, we'll give a fine welcome.\nNow, how go preparations for the party?
And so Aurelius's brilliant star falls as\na new and dark star rises—as well as\nanother dim light at the periphery.
But the flames of battle will not reach\nValkaheim. Should any fool approach,\nit is they who will be reduced to ash.
The massive city strongholds of the prince's\nsiblings lie north of New Alberia.
You would plant your flag in the middle of\nmy empire, Brother? How very amusing.
Yet they remain hopelessly outnumbered.\nWhat are your thoughts, Valyx?
Do not underestimate him. His men fought\nmy undefeated army to deadlock.
If you would stop him, be swift and\ndecisive. Send a large force north\nbefore they become a real threat.
Then send me, Brother! Let me be the one\nto lead that force!
This time, I WILL crush him beneath my\nbootheel! ...Er, or the bootheels of my\nmen, I suppose.
Ever one to keep your own footwear\npristine, Prince Emile.
But the rebel prince IS dangerous.\nWe ought nip that threat in the bud.
Oh, let the boy have his moment.
Besides, {player_name} has a\ncurious way with dragons.\nThat could prove quite useful.
Then we watch and wait for now.\nIf that's all the business before the\ncouncil, I'll take my leave.
I've a lot on my plate, after all. And one\ntasty morsel in particular... Heh heh.
Having founded our kingdom, we now\nmarch west to forge a new alliance.
The Halidom is surrounded by the empire's\nstrongholds, all of which are held by siblings\nwhose motives remain maddeningly unclear.
We'll never survive alone, but if any ally can\ntip the scales, it's Saint Lotier—one of the\ncontinent's largest metropolises.
We've been traveling quite some time.\nSaint Lotier won't be far now.
I hear the leader of the Aquapolis is\nquite a fine man.
He won't soon bend the knee to\nthe empire.
We've declared our independence, but we\nstill lack for manpower and resources.\nAn alliance is our only hope.
Ah, Saint Lotier... A nostalgic name.
And the deep blue sea—my beloved\ncradle.
If we are able to coax the sea's mana back\nto the Halidom, I should be able to erect a\nwater dracolith.
If you offer prayers to it, my powers will\ngrow to new heights.
So we just have to build one of those\nback at the castle and the Waterwyrm\ngets powered up?
Sounds like we REALLY need to hit it off\nwell with the boss around here.
Additionally, I swore to Mercury that I\nwould help defend the seas.
Quick aside here: Are you sure it's a good\nidea for you to leave the castle,\n{player_name}?
Aw, we left a solid force behind to watch\nover the place. They'll be fine.
...Though if ya wanna give up on this\noptimistic plan for an alliance and head\nhome, I'd be all for it.
Turn back? That's unlike you, Ranzal.
Is it your courage that has abandoned you,\nor your faith in {player_name}?
It's neither and ya know it! Just...\nI got a bad feeling about this, yeah?
This ain't the place for stupid arguments,\nthough. The marsh is dangerous.
Dally too long, and we'll have water fiends\nswimmin' up to greet us.
...Oh, hey, you're right! I can hear them\nsplashing around.
They lurk under the surface or in stands\nof tall reeds, then attack. They are a\nmost troubling set of foes.
Then let's hurry. Once we're through this\nstretch, we should be at the Aquapolis's\ndoorstep.
